title: Directs the regents to ensure that a course in the use of the stock market is included during grades nine through twelve
summary: Directs the regents to ensure that a course in the use of the stock market is included during grades nine through twelve; course to include investment concept, savings and relationship to the national economy.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3118

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 24, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by M. of A. HEASTIE -- read once and referred to the Commit-
         tee on Higher Education

       AN ACT to amend the education law, in relation to requiring  instruction
         regarding use of the stock market

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The education law is amended by adding a new section  801-b
    2  to read as follows:
    3    S  801-B.  INSTRUCTION  REGARDING USE OF THE STOCK MARKET. THE REGENTS
    4  SHALL ENSURE THAT THE COURSE  OF  INSTRUCTION  IN  GRADES  NINE  THROUGH
    5  TWELVE  INCLUDES  A COMPONENT ON USE OF THE STOCK MARKET. SUCH COMPONENT
    6  SHALL INSTRUCT STUDENTS ON THE PRINCIPLES OF PRUDENT INVESTMENT, SAVINGS
    7  AND HOW THE STOCK MARKET REFLECTS  THE  NATIONAL  ECONOMY.  THE  REGENTS
    8  SHALL  DETERMINE HOW TO INCORPORATE SUCH COMPONENT IN EXISTING CURRICULA
    9  AND THE COMMISSIONER SHALL PROMULGATE ANY REGULATIONS  NEEDED  TO  CARRY
   10  OUT SUCH DETERMINATION OF THE REGENTS.
   11    S  2.  This act shall take effect on the first of July next succeeding
   12  the date on which it shall have become a law.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD06493-01-1
